description: From Hindustani contraction रिसालदार (risāldār) / رسالدار‎ (risāldār), from रिसालादार (risālādār) / رسالہ دار‎ (risāla-dār), from Persian رساله‌دار‎ (resâle-dâr), from Arabic رِسَالَة‎ (risāla) + Persian agent suffix دار‎ (dâr).

entries.meaning: The native captain of an Indian cavalry regiment.
examples: Then up and spoke Mohammed Khan, the son of the Ressaldar:"If ye know the track of the morning-mist, ye know where his pickets are.  […]
